title: 1. Seminar by Bert Collard: Redesigning IRRIs irrigated rice breeding program Pt. 1

tasks.task: Attend and introduce speakers at a seminar.
subtasks: Greet participants and welcome them to the seminar.
Present a brief introduction of the seminar speaker, Dr. Bert Collier.
Highlight Dr. Collier's background and achievements in rice breeding.

tasks.task: Discuss the history and impact of Erie's irrigated rice breeding program.
subtasks: Mention the development and release of IR8 in 1966 and its significant yield increase.
Highlight the success of IR36 and IR64 varieties, noting their widespread adoption in Southeast Asian countries.
Present data on the economic benefits of Erie's irrigated rice varieties, cited from ACR's independent assessment.

tasks.task: Explain the challenges and necessity of changing the breeding program.
subtasks: Discuss the impact of full cost recovery on breeding operations.
Highlight the high cost of traditional breeding methods in comparison to funding allocations.
Summarize the restructuring and reallocation of breeding activities, including the decentralization of hubs to Hyderabad and Burundi.

tasks.task: Present recent research findings and the challenges in genetic gain.
subtasks: Present results from the era experiment comparing old and modern varieties.
Discus the sliding rate of genetic gain and its insufficient pace to meet future demands.

tasks.task: Describe the new breeding methods and approaches introduced.
subtasks: Explain the transition to Rapid Generation Advance (RGA) technique for early breeding stages.
Describe field trials and replication across multiple locations to accelerate the breeding process.
